actor_awards.notes: Known as 'The Great Profile', he was a stage legend and a major film star of the silent and early talkie eras. Despite his immense talent and acclaimed performances in films like 'Grand Hotel' and 'Twentieth Century', he was never nominated for an Academy Award. He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1960.

filmography.title: Grand Hotel
filmography.role_description: A charming but impoverished aristocrat turned hotel thief who falls in love with a lonely ballerina.
filmography.plot: A group of very different individuals staying at a luxurious hotel in Berlin deal with each of their respective dramas.

filmography.title: Twentieth Century
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical, egocentric Broadway producer who tries to win back his former star on a cross-country train ride.
filmography.plot: A Broadway producer tries to win back his former muse and lover while traveling on the Twentieth Century Limited train.

filmography.title: Dinner at Eight
filmography.role_description: A washed-up, alcoholic silent film star facing the end of his career and financial ruin.
filmography.plot: A New York socialite tries to organize a dinner party for visiting nobility, but her guests are dealing with their own major life crises.

filmography.title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
filmography.role: Dr. Henry Jekyll / Mr. Edward Hyde
filmography.role_description: Barrymore's dual role in this silent classic, famously transforming into Hyde with minimal makeup, relying on facial contortions.
filmography.plot: A scientist unleashes his evil alter ego after taking a formula he created to separate the good and evil sides of human nature.

filmography.title: Counsellor at Law
filmography.role_description: A successful Jewish lawyer who pulled himself up from poverty, now facing a scandal that could destroy his career.
filmography.plot: A high-powered attorney faces a crisis when a rival uncovers a small indiscretion from his past.

filmography.title: Midnight
filmography.role_description: A wealthy aristocrat who hires a showgirl to seduce his wife's lover in this screwball comedy.
filmography.plot: A chorus girl stranded in Paris is set up by a millionaire to break up his wife's affair with another man.

filmography.title: Romeo and Juliet
filmography.role_description: The witty and cynical friend of Romeo, delivering a flamboyant performance despite being in his 50s.
filmography.plot: Two young lovers from feuding families fall in love, leading to tragedy in Verona.

filmography.title: A Bill of Divorcement
filmography.role_description: A shell-shocked WWI veteran who escapes a mental institution and returns home to a family that has moved on.
filmography.plot: A man returns home after fifteen years in an asylum to find his wife divorced and about to remarry, and his daughter contemplating her own future.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Svengali
filmography.role_description: A sinister music maestro who hypnotizes a young woman to make her a famous singer under his control.
filmography.plot: A singing teacher controls the life of a young woman through hypnosis, making her a star but draining her vitality.

filmography.title: Rasputin and the Empress
filmography.role_description: A Russian prince who suspects and investigates the influence of the mad monk Rasputin. The only film to feature John, Ethel, and Lionel Barrymore.
filmography.plot: The story of the mad monk Rasputin and his influence over the Russian Royal family leading up to the revolution.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Original Story

filmography.title: Don Juan
filmography.role: Don Jose de Marana / Don Juan
filmography.role_description: The legendary lover in the first feature-length film with synchronized Vitaphone sound effects and music.
filmography.plot: Don Juan learns that there is more to life than his many conquests when he falls for a woman who resists his charms.

filmography.title: The Sea Beast
filmography.role_description: A romanticized silent film version of Captain Ahab, who loses his leg to Moby Dick.
filmography.plot: Captain Ahab seeks revenge against the white whale that took his leg, while also dealing with a romantic rivalry.

filmography.title: The Beloved Rogue
filmography.role_description: The French poet and vagabond who matches wits with King Louis XI.
filmography.plot: The 15th-century French poet François Villon fights for the love of a lady and the welfare of France.

filmography.title: Tempest
filmography.role_description: A peasant soldier who rises through the ranks during the Russian Revolution.
filmography.plot: A peasant rises to become an officer in the Russian army but is stripped of his rank, only to find the tables turned during the revolution.

filmography.title: Beau Brummel
filmography.role_description: The famous dandy of the Regency era who influences fashion and falls from grace.
filmography.plot: A British military officer becomes a fashion arbiter and close friend of the Prince of Wales, but his arrogance leads to his downfall.

filmography.title: Marie Antoinette
filmography.role_description: The aging King of France who welcomes the young Marie Antoinette to the court.
filmography.plot: The tragic life of Marie Antoinette, from her betrothal to Louis XVI to her execution during the French Revolution.

filmography.title: Maytime
filmography.role_description: A possessive and jealous opera manager who controls the life of his star singer.
filmography.plot: An opera singer falls in love with a baritone, but her jealous manager and husband intervenes, leading to tragedy.

filmography.title: Topaze
filmography.role_description: A naive and honest schoolteacher who is manipulated by corrupt businessmen.
filmography.plot: An honest chemistry teacher is fired and then hired by a corrupt baron to be a figurehead for a shady business.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: Arsène Lupin
filmography.role_description: The gentleman thief who engages in a battle of wits with a police detective (played by his brother Lionel).
filmography.plot: A detective tries to catch a gentleman thief who has announced his intention to steal a valuable painting.

filmography.title: Moby Dick
filmography.role_description: Barrymore reprises his role as Ahab in this early sound remake, which features a happier ending than the novel.
filmography.plot: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the white whale that took his leg, while his fiancée waits for his return.

filmography.title: The Mad Genius
filmography.role_description: A crippled puppeteer and ballet master who manipulates the life of a young dancer.
filmography.plot: A crippled ballet master adopts a young boy and molds him into a famous dancer, but controls his life with obsession.

filmography.title: True Confession
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, drunk criminologist who interacts with a woman who falsely confesses to murder.
filmography.plot: A pathological liar confesses to a murder she didn't commit to help her lawyer husband's career.

filmography.title: Reunion in Vienna
filmography.role_description: A banished Archduke who returns to Vienna and tries to rekindle a romance with a former lover.
filmography.plot: An exiled Archduke returns to Vienna for a reunion and tries to woo back his former mistress, who is now happily married.

filmography.title: Night Flight
filmography.role_description: The stern managing director of an airline who demands dangerous night flights to deliver mail.
filmography.plot: During the early days of aviation, a dedicated airline boss pushes his pilots to fly dangerous night missions in South America.

filmography.title: The Great Profile
filmography.role_description: A role that parodies Barrymore's own life as a fading, alcoholic matinee idol.
filmography.plot: A washed-up, alcoholic actor tries to make a comeback while dealing with his agent, his wife, and a new play.

filmography.title: State's Attorney
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant defense lawyer who becomes a state's attorney with political ambitions.
filmography.plot: A brilliant criminal lawyer becomes a prosecutor and has to choose between his career and his ethics.

filmography.title: Bulldog Drummond Comes Back
filmography.role_description: A police inspector and friend to the amateur detective Bulldog Drummond.
filmography.plot: Bulldog Drummond's fiancée is kidnapped by an old enemy seeking revenge, and he must decipher clues to find her.
